Description: Barbotine goblet in Aswan clay. Reconstructed from fragments. Thin modelled rim that carinates out to a straight shoulder, before tapering sharply to a flat base. Roughly finished. Decorated with a cream slip interior and exterior, then a red band from the rim over the upper body. Upper body decorated with applied decoration in a pale clay.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 22) (Type B7)
